channel.title: mySA.com Express-News
channel.description: About Us: San Antonio, Express-News, Contact Us

item.title: TXCO Resources' net income jumps in 2Q
item.description: Higher oil and gas sales and higher margins led San Antonio-based TXCO Resources Inc. to second quarter net income of $8.7 million, or 24 cents a share, compared with a $1.3 million loss, or 4 cents a share, for the year-earlier period.

item.title: Pioneer Drilling's 1Q net income dips 31%
item.description: Pioneer Drilling Co. Inc. said Tuesday that lower drilling margins and falling use of its rigs prompted a 31 percent decline in net income for the first quarter of 2008.

item.title: San Antonio Express-News History, Part 4: Just yesterday, today and tomorrow
item.description: With the San Antonio Light gone, Jan. 28, 1993, was the first day since its founding in 1865 that the San Antonio Express-News didn't have to at least look over its shoulder to see what another newspaper was doing in the Alamo City.

item.title: San Antonio Express-News History, Part 3: Wild in the streets
item.description: Rupert Murdoch reportedly has described himself as colorless and boring. But considering his impact on the media, that would be something like Bill Clinton describing himself as shy and retiring in the world of politics or Hugh Hefner insisting he's chaste and possesses a low libido when it comes to the sexual revolution.

item.title: San Antonio Express-News History, Part 2: A new century
item.description: It would become known as the American century, and in its early days at least, individual initiative probably was a young man's most prized possession. Hence, it's logical that the dawn of the 20th century saw a young man named Frank Huntress climbing the career ladder at the San Antonio Express.

item.title: San Antonio Express-News History, Part 1: In the beginning
item.description: It was a time legends were being written, and the newspaper that became the San Antonio Express-News was there to get them down in black and white.

item.title: A history of the San Antonio Express-News
item.description: Born 29 years after the fall of the Alamo and just five months after Robert E. Lee's surrender to Ulysses S. Grant, the San Antonio Express-News has done much more than record day-to-day history of the world for nearly a century and a half. It's made a history of its own.

item.title: SAN ANTONIO EXPRESS-NEWS ETHICS AND PRACTICES POLICY
item.description: It is our mission to be the most trusted, respected and accurate source of news and information in the community that we serve. As employees, our fundamental principle is to maintain the integrity of our product.
